source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves sessile or subsessile; leaflets linear-oblanceolate, margins recurved or revolute; stipules absent; calyx teeth much longer than tube; standard hairy
Leaves with petiole more than 2 mm long; leaflets obovate, margins flat; stipules present; calyx teeth not longer than tube; standard more or less glabrous
Inflorescence less than 2 cm long, 3–7-flowered; petioles 2–4 mm long
Inflorescence an elongated raceme, mostly 2–11 mm long, 5–26-flowered; petiole 3–12 mm long
Petiole more than 4 mm long; inflorescence sometimes more than 9 cm long
Petiole c. 3 mm long; inflorescence always less than 9 cm long
